title: (x) Dent'n Scratch logo - Serpentine {Adam Jury}
content:
I need help identifying the font on this logo. so far I have not had any luck and I need to re-create this logo for this client with the exact same font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122000246im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo1_5522.gif)

 [‹ (x) Wide black sans "Freitag" black box logo - Antique Olive Nord {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122000246/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47788 "Go to previous forum topic") [Curly casual sans "What's My Line?" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122000246/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47783 "Go to next forum topic")
author: joepro

comments.content:
I’m pretty sure that’s Chainlink. Here’s an example:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122000246im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/chainlink_5084.jpg)

I noticed the font from my font book. I think I got it for free too.

“Nothing is impossible. The impossible just takes longer.”

Or maybe not. Now that I look at it, the C isn’t nearly wide enough, as are some of the rest of the letters. It’s on the right track though.

“Nothing is impossible. The impossible just takes longer.”

The “Dent’N Scratch” portion is Serpentine. Not sure the exact weight.

[http://www.linotype.com/1465/serpentine-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122000246/http:/www.linotype.com/1465/serpentine-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/1465/serpentine-family.html")
Serpentine is also used by MacGyver, btw.
